page.title: 03LADDINGFORD VILLAGE SHOP
page.content: BRENCHLEY'S SHOP IS JUST OVER 100 YEARS OLD. IT HAS ALWAYS BEEN IN MR. BRENCHLEY'S FAMILY. ABOUT 1,000 HOP-PICKERS CAME TO IT EVERY YEAR UNTIL ABOUT 10 YEARS AGO. THE SHOP USED TO SELL VIRTUALLY EVERYTHING BECAUSE IT WAS THE MAIN SHOP IN THE VILLAGE. MR. BRENCHLEY DOES NOT SELL SUCH A WIDE RANGE NOW BECAUSE THE VILLAGERS TEND TO SHOP IN SUPERMARKETS AT PADDOCK WOOD OR MAIDSTONE. ONCE, THERE WERE NO BUSES RUNNING THROUGH THE VILLAGE SO PEOPLE HAD TO WAIT FOR THE CARRIER TO TAKE THEM INTO MAIDSTONE.WHEN THEY WANTED TO COME BACK THEY WAITED FOR IT TO MAKE ITS RETURN JOURNEY TO BRING THEM HOME.ALL THE OLD PEOPLE FROM THE NEARBY ESTATE USED TO GO TO BRENCHLEY'S FOR THEIR FOOD- AND THEY GO THERE STILL.
